intro: Agrianthus carvalhoi, commonly known as the Carvalho's agrianthus, is a flowering plant native to the island of São Miguel in the Azores. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters. Agrianthus carvalhoi is relatively rare and is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological niche and limited distribution.
